Project Manager

Pedro Pontes

Pedro is a Project Manager with a strong engineering foundation in software and AI-driven projects. Leads cross-functional teams to deliver complex initiatives from R&D to production-ready systems. Experience applying AI Software Development to solve user-centric problems and drive value through iterative development.

PROJECT MANAGEMENT

Technical Project Manager

Managed innovation projects, securing 30 Million â‚¬ in National and EU R&D Funding (Horizon Europe, NextGenerationEU).

Project Management

Managed innovation projects across Germany, USA, and Sweden, coordinating 25 cross-functional team members to deliver AI-based Vehicle Interior Sensing and Autonomous Driving Solutions.

R&D Management

Managed R&D workstreams, overseeing the execution of deliverables and milestones, removing technical and operational blockers, ensuring Agile workflow (SAFe/Scrum) progress between innovation and OEM business goals.

Budgets & Resources Management

Managed project budgets and resource allocation, achieving ~1Million in cost-savings, while managing procurement, negotiating supplier quotations and infrastructure sourcing to support project delivery.

AI Product Development

Led AI-driven product development across the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), from gathering requirements to implementation of Machine Learning (ML) models, sensor data processing pipelines, system integration and driving production-ready software releases.

Roadmap Execution

Defined and executed product vision and technical roadmaps across work packages, making feature prioritization trade-offs to align regulatory requirements (Euro NCAP, FMVSS), release timelines, and stakeholder expectations.

AI Data Privacy Management

Led data privacy and AI regulatory compliance, staying current with GDPR and AI legislation, translating regulatory requirements into product and system configuration decisions in collaboration with Data Security Officers (DSOs).

SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT

Machine Learning Engineer

Development of Machine Learning and Computer Vision solutions for In-Vehicle Interior Sensing and Automated Driving Perception.

MLops Engineering

Led the development of Machine learning (ML) pipelines, covering large-scale dataset preparation (200k+ samples), data ingestion pipeline design, model selection and training, evaluation, deployment, and ongoing performance monitoring.

Generative AI

Built in-vehicle sensor data collection infrastructure, combining real-world data acquisition with Generative AI (GANs-based image synthesis) to mitigate data scarcity and class imbalance, improving model robustness in underrepresented scenarios.

Vehicle Interior Sensing

Developed Interior Sensing and Occupant Monitoring Systems, using multimodal (video + audio) deep learning computer vision models (CNNs, VAEs, Vision Transformers) for human action recognition in shared autonomous vehicles.

Automated Driving Perception

Developed Automated Driving Perception Systems, implementing 2D/3D deep learning models for 3D object detection, semantic-segmentation and 3D scene understanding using multi-sensor inputs (RGB cameras, LiDAR and Radar).

Machine Learning Embedded Inference

Implemented object detection and tracking models, optimizing embedded inference through model quantization, parallel execution and architectural refinements, achieving 20-30% speed improvement while maintaining ~90% detection accuracy.

Team Collaboration

Collaborated with cross-functional teams to transition proofs-of-concept into production-ready AI solutions for deployment in vehicles, ensuring alignment with performance, scalability, and Euro NCAP safety requirements.

Developed an IoT embedded sensor hub integrating ambient sensors, motion sensors, and pressure sensors for bed/chair occupancy detection.
Deployed machine learning inference pipelines on embedded systems, enabling offline operation in hospital and nursing care homes.
Developed an healthcare system, integrating vendor-locked hardware from end-user Danish organizations into an open architecture.
Reduced system production costs by ~80% compared to equivalent commercial healthcare solutions.

Contributed to scene understanding and localization tasks by running SLAM experiments in simulation to evaluate object positions and vehicle trajectories.
